title: Stockton on the Forest Walks

images.title: Chris Heaton / On Carrbank Lane
images.caption: On Carrbank Lane. Runs north from pastures, into the village of Stockton in the Forest.

images.title: Carrbank Lane towards Stockton on the Forest by Ian S, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Carrbank Lane view

images.title: Warthill village pond by Ian S, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Warthill village pond. This pond is sat opposite the Agar Arms in Warthill and across the road from the church. A small track starts here leading across to Gate Helmsley.

images.title: DS Pugh / Warthill
images.caption: Warthill. Looking over the road in Warthill from next to the Agar Arms pub. To the left goes towards Holtby. A track to the right runs over the fields to Gate Helmsley.

images.title: Sam Kelly / The Agar Arms
images.caption: The white building is Warthill's local pub, the Agar Arms.

images.title: Rudcarr Lane entering Warthill by Ian S, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Rudcarr Lane entering Warthill

images.title: DS Pugh, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Holtby Church

images.title: DS Pugh / Straw bales off Rudcarr Lane
images.caption: Straw bales off Rudcarr Lane

description:
This little village is located a few miles north east of the city of York. There's some nice local trails to follow around some attractive farmland. This circular walk from the village visits the neighbouring settlements of Warthill and Holtby. The walk starts in the village and follows Carrbank Lane through pleasant farmland towards Warthill where there's a nice village pond, a good local pub and an old church. You then head west along Rudcarr Lane before turning south to visit Holtby.
The route then returns to Stockton via the farmland around Beanland Lane.
